question:
A 15-year-old girl comes to the physician because she has not had menstrual bleeding for the past 3 months. Menses had previously occurred at irregular 15–45 day intervals with moderate to heavy flow. Menarche was at the age of 14 years. She started having sexual intercourse with her boyfriend about 3 months ago. Six months ago she had a manic episode, which was treated with risperidone. Her mother has PCOS and her father has diabetes mellitus. She is very conscious of her weight and appearance. She is 171 cm (5 ft 6 in) tall and weighs 79 kg (174 lb); BMI is 27.02 kg/m2. Her temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 60/min, and blood pressure is 116/70 mm Hg. The abdomen is soft and nontender. Pelvic examination shows a normal vagina and cervix. Serum hormone studies show:
Prolactin 16 ng/mL
Thyroid-stimulating hormone 3.8 μU/mL
Follicle-stimulating hormone 6 mIU/mL
Luteinizing hormone 5.1 mIU/mL
Progesterone 0.8 ng/mL (follicular N <3; luteal N >3–5)
Testosterone 2.2 nmol/L (N <3.5)
A urine pregnancy test is negative. Which of the following is the most likely cause of her symptoms?"
options: D)Congenital defect of the Mullerian ducts
prompt:
Q:A 15-year-old girl comes to the physician because she has not had menstrual bleeding for the past 3 months. Menses had previously occurred at irregular 15–45 day intervals with moderate to heavy flow. Menarche was at the age of 14 years. She started having sexual intercourse with her boyfriend about 3 months ago. Six months ago she had a manic episode, which was treated with risperidone. Her mother has PCOS and her father has diabetes mellitus. She is very conscious of her weight and appearance. She is 171 cm (5 ft 6 in) tall and weighs 79 kg (174 lb); BMI is 27.02 kg/m2. Her temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 60/min, and blood pressure is 116/70 mm Hg. The abdomen is soft and nontender. Pelvic examination shows a normal vagina and cervix. Serum hormone studies show:
Prolactin 16 ng/mL
Thyroid-stimulating hormone 3.8 μU/mL
Follicle-stimulating hormone 6 mIU/mL
Luteinizing hormone 5.1 mIU/mL
Progesterone 0.8 ng/mL (follicular N <3; luteal N >3–5)
Testosterone 2.2 nmol/L (N <3.5)
A urine pregnancy test is negative. Which of the following is the most likely cause of her symptoms?"A)Uterine fibroids B)Anovulation C)Purging behavior D)Congenital defect of the Mullerian ducts

A:
output1: <bot> A: The patient's history of irregular menses and the absence of menstrual bleeding for the past 3 months, along with the presence of a soft and nontender abdomen, are consistent with a diagnosis of uterine fibroids. Additionally, the patient's age and the fact that she has had sexual intercourse in the past 3 months increase the likelihood of this diagnosis.
output2: <bot>: Anovulation is the most likely cause of her symptoms because she has not had menstrual bleeding for the past 3 months, and her menstrual cycles have been irregular in the past. Additionally, her serum hormone studies show that her progesterone levels are low, which is consistent with anovulation. Anovulation is a common cause of amenorrhea (the absence of menstrual bleeding) and can be caused by a variety of factors, including polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), thyroid disorders, and other hormonal imbalances.
output3: <bot> A: The patient's symptoms of irregular menses, amenorrhea, and weight loss are consistent with a diagnosis of purging behavior, a common feature of eating disorders such as bulimia nervosa. The patient's height and weight are also consistent with a diagnosis of bulimia nervosa. Additionally, the patient's history of manic episode and the use of risperidone suggest a possible diagnosis of bipolar disorder, which is often comorbid with eating disorders.

question: Nasal vestibule is
options: B)Antero - inferior pa of nasal cavity
prompt:
Q:Nasal vestibule isA)Supero - medial pa of nose B)Antero - inferior pa of nasal cavity C)Lateral pa of nasal cavity D)Posterior apeure of nose

A:
output1: <bot> A: Because the nasal vestibule is the area between the nostrils, and the superior medial portion of the nose is the area closest to the nasal septum.
output2: <bot>: Because the nasal vestibule is the opening between the nostrils and the nasal cavity, and the antero-inferior portion of the nasal cavity is the area closest to the nostrils. Therefore, the nasal vestibule is best described as the antero-inferior portion of the nasal cavity.
output3: <bot> A: Because the nasal vestibule is the lateral part of the nasal cavity, which is located on the side of the nose.
output4: <bot>: The posterior apex of the nose is the most superior part of the nasal cavity, and it is the area that is most sensitive to nasal stimuli.

question: Which of the following require/s co-transport with sodium for its/their absorption in the GItract?
prompt:
Q:Which of the following require/s co-transport with sodium for its/their absorption in the GItract?A)Proteins B)Glucose C)All of these D)Galactose

A:
output1: <bot>: Because proteins are transported across the gut wall by means of a sodium-dependent transport mechanism.
output2: <bot>: Glucose is a simple sugar that is absorbed in the small intestine through a process called facilitated diffusion. This process requires the presence of sodium ions (Na+) in the intestinal fluid to facilitate the movement of glucose molecules into the cells of the small intestine. Without sufficient sodium ions, the absorption of glucose would be inhibited. Therefore, option B)Glucose is the correct answer.
output3: <bot>: Because all of the above nutrients require co-transport with sodium for their absorption in the gut. Sodium ions are essential for the proper functioning of the Na+/K+-ATPase pump, which is responsible for the absorption of nutrients in the gut.
output4: <bot>: Galactose is not absorbed by the intestinal cells on its own, it requires co-transport with sodium ions for its absorption in the gut.

question: Broken ampula is thrown into which coloured bin?
prompt:

A:
output1:
<bot>: Because the broken ampula is likely to be contaminated with biological fluids, and the red bin is designated for biohazardous waste.

output2: <bot>: Because broken glass, including broken ampules, should be disposed of in the yellow bin.
output3: A)Because the broken ampula is made of black plastic.B)Because the broken ampula is too heavy to be recycled.C)Because the broken ampula is too small to be recycled.D)Because the broken ampula is not recyclable.
output4: <bot>: Because the ampula is broken, and broken items are usually thrown away in the blue bin.

question: Non-depolarizing muscle relaxant is administered, can help the endotracheal tube placement. The following drugs are what benzyl-isoquinolinium compounds do not release histamine and, more no drop in blood pressure after administration of the drug?
prompt:
Q:Non-depolarizing muscle relaxant is administered, can help the endotracheal tube placement. The following drugs are what benzyl-isoquinolinium compounds do not release histamine and, more no drop in blood pressure after administration of the drug?A)cis-atracurium B)d-tubocurarine C)pancuronium D)mivacurium

A:
output1: <bot>: Cis-atracurium is a non-depolarizing muscle relaxant that does not release histamine and does not cause a drop in blood pressure after administration.
output3: <bot>: Pancuronium is a non-depolarizing muscle relaxant that does not release histamine, which can cause a drop in blood pressure. The other options, cis-atracurium, d-tubocurarine, and mivacurium, are all depolarizing muscle relaxants that can cause a rise in intracellular calcium, leading to the release of histamine and potentially causing a drop in blood pressure.
output4: <bot>: Mivacurium is a non-depolarizing muscle relaxant that does not release histamine, which can cause a drop in blood pressure after administration of the drug. The other options, cis-atracurium, d-tubocurarine, and pancuronium, are all depolarizing muscle relaxants that can cause a drop in blood pressure after administration.

question: Which of the following is not the component of qSOFA?
prompt:
Q:Which of the following is not the component of qSOFA?A)Altered mental status B)Respiratory rate >22/min C)Unequally dilated pupils D)Systolic BP<100 mmHg

A:
output2: <bot>: Because the qSOFA includes altered mental status (A), unequally dilated pupils (C), and systolic BP <100 mmHg (D), but not respiratory rate >22/min (B).
output3: <bot>: Because unequally dilated pupils are not a component of the quick Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (qSOFA). The qSOFA is a tool used to assess the degree of organ dysfunction in critically ill patients, and it includes assessment of respiratory rate, systolic blood pressure, and mental status, but not pupillary size or reactivity.
output4: <bot>: Because systolic BP <100 mmHg is not a component of qSOFA. The components of qSOFA are:

question: A strategy that can be used in the fading phase of a chip economy system is:
correct_answer: Increase the number of reinforcers gained by the execution of the target behavior.
options: A)Increase the number of reinforcers gained by the execution of the target behavior.
B)Increase the number of behaviors that allow reinforcers to gain.
C)Decrease the time between the delivery of reinforcers.
D)Increase the requirement to obtain reinforcers.
prompt:
Q:A strategy that can be used in the fading phase of a chip economy system is:A)Increase the number of reinforcers gained by the execution of the target behavior. B)Increase the number of behaviors that allow reinforcers to gain. C)Decrease the time between the delivery of reinforcers. D)Increase the requirement to obtain reinforcers.

A:
output1: <bot> A: Because increasing the number of reinforcers gained by the target behavior will increase the rate at which the behavior is performed, which can help to sustain the behavior in the fading phase.
output2: <bot>: During the fading phase of a chip economy system, the goal is to increase the number of behaviors that allow reinforcers to be gained, as this will increase the number of opportunities for reinforcement and help to maintain the desired behavior.
output3: <bot>: Because, in the fading phase of a chip economy system, the goal is to increase the rate at which reinforcers are delivered to the learner. By decreasing the time between the delivery of reinforcers, the learner is more likely to receive reinforcement for their target behavior, which can help to maintain their performance.
output4: <bot> A: Increasing the requirement to obtain reinforcers is a strategy that can be used in the fading phase of a chip economy system because it helps to maintain the desired behavior by making the reinforcers more valuable and scarce. This can help to keep the learners motivated and engaged in the behavior.

question: Lower density usually means
prompt:
Q:Lower density usually meansA)Lighter weight B)High strength C)Low melting temperature D)Low strength

A:
output1: <bot>: Because materials with lower density generally have a lower mass per unit volume, which means they are lighter in weight.
output2: <bot>: Because materials with lower density tend to have higher strength-to-weight ratios, which means that they are stronger relative to their weight.
output3:
<bot>: Because materials with lower density tend to have lower melting points.
<human>
output4: <bot>: Because lower density materials tend to be weaker and less resistant to stress, which leads to a lower strength.

question: If probing force is upto 30gms then the probe remains:
prompt:
Q:If probing force is upto 30gms then the probe remains:A)Within JE. B)At the base of sulcus. C)Beyond  the base of sulcus. D)Bone sounding.

A:
output1:
<bot>: When the probe is applied with a force of up to 30gms, it remains within the JE (jaw-elevator) muscle. The JE muscle is responsible for elevating the mandible during biting and protrusion of the jaw. The probe will not be able to penetrate beyond the base of the sulcus because the JE muscle is too strong and the probe will be resisted by it.
<human>
output2: <bot>: Because the probing force of 30gms is not sufficient to penetrate beyond the base of the sulcus.
output3: <bot>: When the probing force is up to 30gms, the probe will be able to penetrate beyond the base of the sulcus, but not so far as to cause bone sounding.
output4: <bot>: When the probing force is up to 30gms, the probe will produce a bone sounding indication, indicating that the probe has penetrated the cortical bone and entered the medullary canal.

question: Mitral valve replacement is recommended in patients with
correct_answer: Severe MS in NYHA class II
options: A)Moderate MS in NYHA class II
B)Moderate MS in NYHA class III
C)Severe MS in NYHA class III
D)Severe MS in NYHA class II
prompt:
Q:Mitral valve replacement is recommended in patients withA)Moderate MS in NYHA class II B)Moderate MS in NYHA class III C)Severe MS in NYHA class III D)Severe MS in NYHA class II

A:
output1: <bot> A: Because the guideline recommends mitral valve replacement for patients with moderate MS in NYHA class II.
output2: <bot>: Because the guideline recommends mitral valve replacement for patients with moderate MS in NYHA class III, as they have a higher risk of adverse outcomes due to their symptoms and decreased left ventricular function.
output3: <bot>: Because patients with severe mitral regurgitation (MR) in NYHA class III have more severe symptoms and are at higher risk for adverse outcomes, including death, compared to those in NYHA class II.
output4: <bot>: Because severe mitral regurgitation in NYHA class II is a more urgent condition than moderate regurgitation in NYHA class III, and mitral valve replacement is recommended for patients with severe regurgitation to prevent complications such as heart failure, atrial fibrillation, and stroke.
